title: Man Utd transfer news: Thomas Muller not for sale, claims Bayern Munich chief
text:
Thomas Muller has attracted interest from Manchester United (Picture: Getty)

Bayern Munich sporting director Hasan Salihamidzic has ruled out the possibility of Thomas Muller leaving the club in the January transfer window.

The German is unhappy with a lack of playing time at the Allianz Arena and claimed earlier this month he could seek a move when the transfer window reopens.

Manchester United have long admired the 30-year-old and recent reports claim Ole Gunnar Solskjaer has approved a move for the forward.

However, Salhiamidzic has poured cold water on suggestions Muller could move to Old Trafford.

Solskjaer is keen to sign an attacker (Picture: Getty)

‘That’s a story you want to write [Muller being sold],’ said the Bayern chief.

‘We have two players [Niklas Sule and Lucas Hernandez] out for months and you are trying to tell us to sell a player. There’s no reason for doing this.’

Advertisement

Advertisement

Solskjaer is keen to bolster his frontline and United are interested in Juventus striker Mario Mandzukic and Lyon’s Moussa Dembele.

Anthony Martial is set to return for his first league start in over two months in today’s clash against Norwich City.

MORE: Man Utd to launch £125m foray for Thomas Muller and Kai Havertz after Ed Woodward gives green light
